Authors:
Enayra Silva Sousa, Janaine Rossane Araujo Silva, Iraildes
Pereira Assuncao, Maruzanete Prereira Melo, Frederico Monteiro Feijo,
Kedma da Silva Matos, Gaus Silvestre Andrade Lima, Jose Evandro Beserra
Junior
Title:
Colletotrichum species causing anthracnose in lima bean in
the Northeast of Brazil
Keywords:
Colletotrichum cliviae, Colletotrichum fructicola,
Colletotrichum truncatum, multilocus analysis, Phaseolus lunatus.
Abstract:
The taxonomy of the genus Colletotrichum has undergone
various changes. These alterations arise from the use of modern
molecular tools. Currently, Colletotrichum species are grouped into
complexes. Species of Colletotrichum associated with diseases in lima
bean have been investigated very little. In Brazil, anthracnose in lima
bean has often been associated with Colletotrichum truncatum, but only
morphological markers have been used in identifying the species. In the
current work, samples of lima bean with symptoms of spots on the leaves
and pods have been collected on properties in municipalities in Piauí
and Alagoas states. Microscopy analyses revealed isolates with
cylindrical and curved conidia. The isolate of Colletotrichum cliviae
(CMM 3366) produced only the sexual phase, with superficial perithecia,
with eight curved ascospores. The ITS region and fractions of the genes
GAPDH, β-tubulin and Actin were amplified by PCR, sequenced and
submitted to phylogenetic analysis. The isolates from this study grouped
with reference isolates from C. truncatum, C. cliviae and Colletotrichum
fructicola. All the isolates were pathogenic to 25-day-old lima bean
plants. Therefore, this work confirms the pathogenicity of C. truncatum
to lima bean and for the first time records the occurrence of C. cliviae
and C. fructicola as pathogens of this host in Brazil.
